title: Prince Andrew 'says 2010 visit to see Jeffrey Epstein in New York was to end their friendship'
text:
Prince Andrew says the visit to see Jeffrey Epstein in 2010 was to tell the paedophile they could no longer be friends.

The Duke of York told friends the trip to New York was to break off contact with Epstein after he had been convicted of child sex offences.

Andrew's friendship with the billionaire financier, who was found hanged in his cell in August after being charged with child-trafficking offences, has come under intense scrutiny.

Prince Andrew visited the financier's £60million Manhattan house in December 2010, shortly after Epstein had been released from an 18-month sentence for child prostitution offences

But according to The Sunday Times, despite initially refusing to criticise his friend, the Queen's second son now accepts Epstein was an 'undercover' paedophile similar to Jimmy Savile.

A source close to Andrew said Epstein was 'very good at keeping his cover' and was a 'trophy friend' for the prince.

One of Epstein's alleged victims Virginia Roberts Giuffre has alleged she was recruited as a 'sex slave' and forced to have sex with Prince Andrew in London.

He has strongly denied any 'sexual contact or relationship' with her or any 'impropriety with underage minors'.

Prince Andrew visited Epstein on Epstein's atoll in the US Virgin Islands several times, dubbed Paedophile Island because of the stream of young women arriving.

He also visited the financier's £60million Manhattan house in December 2010, shortly after Epstein had been released from an 18-month sentence for child prostitution offences.

The duke was pictured waving to a young woman leaving the Manhattan mansion where the FBI later found thousands of graphic photos with many of underage girls

The source said: 'The duke has been hammered for one mistake, which took place in 2010.

'He has apologised again and again for the error of judgment. But what he did wasn't criminal. It was a mistake. He went to see a friend to tell them he couldn't be their friend any more.'

Despite this, it has been established that Epstein organised a dinner in Andrew's honour during that visit with guests including Woody Allen, Katie Couric, Charlie Rose, Chelsea Handler and George Stephanopoulos.

The duke was then pictured waving to a young woman leaving the mansion where the FBI later found thousands of graphic photos with many of underage girls.

The FBI has announced it will be expanding its investigation into Epstein hoping to identify more victims who could provide information on other abusers.

Sources close to Prince Andrew say he doubts the authenticity of a photo with his arm around the waist of Virginia Roberts Giuffre, then aged 17

The Department of Justice said it would not give Andrew any special treatment because of his royal status.

Another embarrassment for the duke is a 2001 photograph of him with his arm around the waist of Roberts Giuffre who was then 17.

But sources close to the duke say he doubts the photo's authenticity and says the original has never surfaced.

However, the Department of Justice and the FBI believe the photo is genuine.
